main event: Mr. [redacted] and a companion observed a bright luminous object in the sky while driving near Waitomo, New Zealand, on the evening of December 14, 1950.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for a star but revealed itself to be a large self-luminous object,The sighting lasted approximately one minute,During this time, the object changed direction and altitude,The object was first seen at about 30 degrees above the horizon and disappeared at about 15 degrees,The report is part of Project Blue Book from the US Air Force.
sighted object: a bright luminous object in the sky
witness description: Mr. [redacted] and his companion, both driving home from Te Awamutu to Hamilton.
